title: Man Utd suffer huge blow as Solskjaer provides Paul Pogba injury update
text:
Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba is struggling with an ankle injury (Picture: Getty)

Paul Pogba is set to be out of action for at least another month due to a troublesome ankle injury, Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has confirmed.

French World Cup-winner Pogba has endured a frustrating campaign with injuries limiting him to just five Premier League appearances for the struggling Red Devils.

The 26-year-old has not featured for Manchester United since the end of September and missed the 3-1 win over Norwich City on Sunday.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer confirmed the news after United beat Norwich City (Picture: Getty)

Pogba suggested he was closing in on a return from the treatment room on social media last week but Solskjaer does not expect the midfielder to be available until December.

‘I don’t think we’ll see him maybe before December,’ Solskjaer said. ‘He’ll be out for a while. He needs time to fully, fully recover, so I don’t think he’ll be back.

‘Maybe Sheffield United (on November 24) after the international break but probably December before you can see him.

‘It’s the ankle rather than foot. I’m not the doctor but there is an injury there that needs healing.’

Despite their poor start to the season, Manchester United have enjoyed a promising week, holding Premier League leaders Liverpool to a draw before beating Partizan Belgrade and Norwich City.

Their 2-1 win over Norwich on Sunday was the first time United have won a Premier League away game since February and Solskjaer said: ‘This had been a good week for us.

‘It started with a decent performance against Liverpool and now two wins away from home. It gives the players confidence and momentum.

‘The third was a very good goal and a class finish. It is great for Anthony Martial to score a goal like that. We could and should have had a few more goals.’

Solskjaer’s side face Premier League rivals Chelsea in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup on Wednesday evening.
